result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ TBE 04/04/22 - DENIED: the person is not indigent
**Clerk left voice message for defendant on 04/06/22 in the A.M. with regards to the denial of the court appointed attorney

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew W Zarda in court. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states he makes too much so he doesn't qualify and he can't afford one.  He did not receive the denial paperwork for the public defender. 
Court advises the defendant of the right to apply for indigency status and have counsel appointed for him.  Informs him to pick up the indigency paperwork from the Branch 1 office. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Court will adjourn to allow the defendant time to confirm with the public defender that he does not qualify and file the indigency petition. 
Defendant verifies his address is correct.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with D.L.F. or B.C.K.

2:16 PM Defendant Andrew W Zarda appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, ADA Brian Pfeil, appeared in court. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant is to go to the public defender's office.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  
Court will continue this hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
